info.title: Proxmox PowerShell VE
info.summary: Module to manage proxmox instances via api
info.description: Generated module to access all Proxmox VE Api Endpoints. This module has been generated from the proxmox api description v. 8.4.0

parameters.name: sid
parameters.description: HA resource ID. This consists of a resource type followed by a resource specific name, separated with colon (example: vm:100 / ct:100). For virtual machines and containers, you can simply use the VM or CT id as a shortcut (example: 100).

get.description: API version details, including some parts of the global datacenter config.

id.description: Unique identifier for this metric object, for instance 'node/<nodename>' or 'qemu/<vmid>'.

timestamp.description: Time at which this metric was observed

expire.description: API token expiration date (seconds since epoch). '0' means no expiration date.

privsep.description: Restrict API token privileges with separate ACLs (default), or give full privileges of corresponding user.

status.description: Indicating enabled/disabled status, if the repository is configured.

digest.description: Digest of the file as bytes.

Enabled.description: Whether the repository is enabled or not

index.description: Index of the associated repository within the file.

property.description: Property from which the info originates.

path.description: Absolute directory path that should be shared with the guest.

children.description: The volumes of the guest with the information if they will be included in backups.

included.description: Whether the volume is included in the backup or not.

reason.description: The reason why the volume is included (or excluded).

type.description: Type of the guest, VM, CT or unknown for removed but not purged guests.

free.description: The free bytes in the physical volume

name.description: The name of the physical volume

size.description: The size of the physical volume in bytes

free.description: The free bytes in the volume group

name.description: The name of the volume group

size.description: The size of the volume group in bytes

description.description: Description of the node specific device.

id.description: The vendor and device ID that is expected. Used for detecting hardware changes

iommugroup.description: The IOMMU group in which the device is to be expected in. Used for detecting hardware changes.

path.description: The path to the device. If the function is omitted, the whole device is mapped. In that case use the attributes of the first device. You can give multiple paths as a semicolon seperated list, the first available will then be chosen on guest start.

subsystem-id.description: The subsystem vendor and device ID that is expected. Used for detecting hardware changes.

expire.description: API token expiration date (seconds since epoch). '0' means no expiration date.

privsep.description: Restrict API token privileges with separate ACLs (default), or give full privileges of corresponding user.

description.description: Description of the node specific device.

id.description: The vendor and device ID that is expected. If a USB path is given, it is only used for detecting hardware changes

path.description: The path to the usb device.
Absolute directory path that should be shared with the guest.

items.description: Full User ID, in the `name@realm` format.

avail.description: The available bytes in the root filesystem.

free.description: The free bytes on the root filesystem.

total.description: The total size of the root filesystem in bytes.

used.description: The used bytes in the root filesystem.

version.description: OS kernel version with build info

cores.description: The number of physical cores of the CPU.

cpus.description: The number of logical threads of the CPU.

sockets.description: The number of logical threads of the CPU.

mode.description: Through which firmware the system got booted.

secureboot.description: System is booted in secure mode, only applicable for the "efi" mode.

msg.description: An optional message about the vdev.

name.description: The name of the vdev or section.

ring0_addr.description: Address and priority information of a single corosync link. (up to 8 links supported; link0..link7)

address.description: Hostname (or IP) of this corosync link address.

priority.description: The priority for the link when knet is used in 'passive' mode (default). Lower value means higher priority. Only valid for cluster create, ignored on node add.

description.description: Description of the node specific device.

id.description: The vendor and device ID that is expected. Used for detecting hardware changes

iommugroup.description: The IOMMU group in which the device is to be expected in. Used for detecting hardware changes.

path.description: The path to the device. If the function is omitted, the whole device is mapped. In that case use the attributes of the first device. You can give multiple paths as a semicolon seperated list, the first available will then be chosen on guest start.

subsystem-id.description: The subsystem vendor and device ID that is expected. Used for detecting hardware changes.

description.description: Description of the node specific device.

id.description: The vendor and device ID that is expected. If a USB path is given, it is only used for detecting hardware changes

path.description: The path to the usb device.

expire.description: API token expiration date (seconds since epoch). '0' means no expiration date.

privsep.description: Restrict API token privileges with separate ACLs (default), or give full privileges of corresponding user.

items.description: A single part of the program + arguments.

unavailable_storages.description: A list of not available storages.

cdrom.description: True if the disk is a cdrom.

is_unused.description: True if the disk is unused.

size.description: The size of the disk in bytes.

back_addr.description: Address and port used to talk to other OSDs.

front_addr.description: Address and port used to talk to clients and monitors.

hb_back_addr.description: Heartbeat address and port for other OSDs.

hb_front_addr.description: Heartbeat address and port for clients and monitors.

hostname.description: Name of the host containing the OSD.

mem_usage.description: Memory usage of the OSD service.

osd_data.description: Path to the OSD's data directory.

osd_objectstore.description: The type of object store used.

version.description: Ceph version of the OSD service.

support_discard.description: Discard support of the physical device

type.description: Type of device. For example, hdd or ssd

{id}.description: Useful properties are listed, but not the full list.

ceph_version.description: Version info currently used by the service.

ceph_version_short.description: Short version (numerical) info currently used by the service.

hostname.description: Hostname on which the service is running.

mem_swap_kb.description: Memory of the service currently in swap.
